arguments.description: Replace <number-list> with an actual accrual time list.

arguments.name: MAX
arguments.description: Can be used when each scenario in the analysis contains at least one piecewise linear survival curve (in the GROUPSURVIVAL= or REFSURVIVAL= option). It causes the accrual time to be automatically set, separately for each scenario, to the maximum possible time supported by the piecewise linear survival curve(s) in that scenario. It is not compatible with the FOLLOWUPTIME=MAX option or the TOTALTIME= option.

arguments.name: ALPHA=
arguments.description: Specifies the level of significance of the statistical test. The default is 0.05, corresponding to the usual 0.05 x 100% = 5% level of significance.

arguments.name: CURVE=
arguments.description: Defines a survival curve. For the CURVE= option, label identifies the curve in the output and with the GROUPLOSS=, GROUPSURVIVAL=, and REFSURVIVAL= options.

arguments.name: EVENTSTOTAL=
arguments.description: Specifies the expected total number of events—that is, deaths, whether observed or censored—during the entire study period, or requests a solution for this parameter with a missing value (EVENTSTOTAL=.). The NFRACTIONAL option is automatically enabled when the EVENTSTOTAL= option is used.

arguments.name: FOLLOWUPTIME=
arguments.description: Specifies the follow-up time, the amount of time in the study past the accrual time. If the GROUPSURVIVAL= or REFSURVIVAL= option is used, then the value of the total time (the sum of accrual and follow-up times) must be less than or equal to the largest time in each multipoint (piecewise linear) survival curve.

arguments.name: number-list
arguments.description: Replace <number-list> with an actual follow-up time list.

arguments.name: MAX
arguments.description: Can be used when each scenario in the analysis contains at least one piecewise linear survival curve (in the GROUPSURVIVAL= or REFSURVIVAL= option). It causes the follow-up time to be automatically set, separately for each scenario, to the maximum possible time supported by the piecewise linear survival curve(s) in that scenario. It is not compatible with the ACCRUALTIME=MAX option or the TOTALTIME= option.

arguments.name: GROUPACCRUALRATES=
arguments.description: Specifies the accrual rate for each group. The groupwise accrual rates are the numbers of subjects in each group that enters the study per time unit during the accrual period. The NFRACTIONAL option is automatically enabled when the GROUPACCRUALRATES= option is used.

arguments.name: GROUPEVENTS=
arguments.description: Specifies the expected number of events in each group—that is, deaths, whether observed or censored—during the entire study period. The NFRACTIONAL option is automatically enabled when the GROUPEVENTS= option is used.

arguments.name: GROUPLOSS=
arguments.description: Specifies the exponential loss survival curve for each group, by using labels specified with the CURVE= option. Loss is assumed to follow an exponential curve, indicating the expected rate of censoring (in other words, loss to follow-up) over time.

arguments.name: GROUPMEDLOSSTIMES=
arguments.description: Specifies the median times of the loss in each group. Loss is assumed to follow an exponential curve, indicating the expected rate of censoring (in other words, loss to follow-up) over time.

arguments.name: GROUPMEDSURVTIMES=
arguments.description: Specifies the median survival times in each group. When the GROUPMEDSURVTIMES= option is used, the survival curve in each group is assumed to be exponential.

arguments.name: GROUPNS=
arguments.description: Specifies the two group sample sizes.

arguments.name: GROUPSURVEXPHAZARDS=
arguments.description: Specifies exponential hazard rates of the survival curve for each group.

arguments.name: GROUPSURVIVAL=
arguments.description: Specifies the survival curve for each group, by using labels specified with the CURVE= option.

arguments.name: GROUPWEIGHTS=
arguments.description: Specifies the sample size allocation weights for the two groups. This option controls how the total sample size is divided between the two groups. Each pair of values for the two groups represents relative allocation weights. Additionally, if the NFRACTIONAL option is not used, the total sample size is restricted to be equal to a multiple of the sum of the 'two group weights (so that the resulting design has an integer sample size for each group while adhering exactly to the group allocation weights). Values must be integers unless the NFRACTIONAL option is used. The default value is (1 1), a balanced design with a weight of 1 for each group.

arguments.name: HAZARDRATIO=
arguments.description: Specifies the hazard ratio of the second group's survival curve to the first group's survival curve.

arguments.name: NFRACTIONAL
arguments.description: Enables fractional input and output for sample sizes. This option is automatically enabled when any of the following options are used: ACCRUALRATEPERGROUP=, ACCRUALRATETOTAL=, EVENTSPERGROUP=, EVENTSTOTAL=, GROUPACCRUALRATES=, and GROUPEVENTS=.

arguments.name: NPERGROUP=
arguments.description: Specifies the common sample size per group or requests a solution for the common sample size per group with a missing value (NPERGROUP==.). Use of this option implicitly specifies a balanced design.

arguments.name: NSUBINTERVAL=
arguments.description: Specifies the number of subintervals per unit time to use in internal calculations. Higher values increase computational time and memory requirements but generally lead to more accurate results. The default value is 12.

arguments.name: NTOTAL=
arguments.description: Specifies the sample size or requests a solution for the sample size with a missing value (NTOTAL=.).

arguments.name: OUTPUTORDER=
arguments.description: Controls how the input and default analysis parameters are ordered in the output. OUTPUTORDER=INTERNAL is the default.

arguments.name: INTERNAL
arguments.description: Arranges the parameters in the output according to the following order of their corresponding options: SIDES= ACCRUALTIME= FOLLOWUPTIME= TOTALTIME= NSUBINTERVAL= ALPHA= REFSURVIVAL= GROUPSURVIVAL= REFSURVEXPHAZARD= HAZARDRATIO= GROUPSURVEXPHAZARDS= GROUPMEDSURVTIMES= GROUPLOSSEXPHAZARDS= GROUPLOSS= GROUPMEDLOSSTIMES= GROUPWEIGHTS= NTOTAL= ACCRUALRATETOTAL= EVENTSTOTAL= NPERGROUP= ACCRUALRATEPERGROUP= EVENTSPERGROUP= GROUPNS= GROUPACCRUALRATES= GROUPEVENTS= POWER=

arguments.name: REVERSE
arguments.description: Arranges the parameters in the output in the reverse of the order in which their corresponding options are specified in the TWOSAMPLESURVIVAL statement.

arguments.name: SYNTAX
arguments.description: Arranges the parameters in the output in the same order in which their corresponding options are specified in the TWOSAMPLESURVIVAL statement.

arguments.name: POWER=
arguments.description: Specifies the desired power of the test or requests a solution for the power with a missing value (POWER=.). The power is expressed as a probability, a number between 0 and 1, rather than as a percentage. This option cannot be used with the CI=DIFF analysis.

arguments.name: REFSURVEXPHAZARD=
arguments.description: Specifies the exponential hazard rate of the survival curve for the first (reference) group.

arguments.name: REFSURVIVAL=
arguments.description: Specifies the survival curve for the first (reference) group, by using labels specified with the CURVE= option.

arguments.name: SIDES=
arguments.description: Specifies the number of sides (or tails) and the direction of the statistical test or confidence interval. The default value is 2.
One-sided with alternative hypothesis in same direction as effect
Two-sided

arguments.name: U
arguments.description: Upper one-sided with alternative greater than null value

arguments.name: L
arguments.description: Lower one-sided with alternative less than null value

arguments.name: TEST=
arguments.description: Specifies the statistical analysis.

arguments.name: GEHAN
arguments.description: Specifies the Gehan rank test.

arguments.name: LOGRANK
arguments.description: Specifies the log-rank test. This is the default.

arguments.name: TARONEWARE
arguments.description: Specifies the Tarone-Ware rank test.

arguments.name: TOTALTIME=
arguments.description: Specifies the total time, which is equal to the sum of accrual and follow-up times. If the GROUPSURVIVAL= or REFSURVIVAL= option is used, then the value of the total time must be less than or equal to the largest time in each multipoint (piecewise linear) survival curve.

arguments.name: number-list
arguments.description: Replace <number-list> with an actual total time list.

arguments.name: MAX
arguments.description: Can be used when each scenario in the analysis contains at least one piecewise linear survival curve (in the GROUPSURVIVAL= or REFSURVIVAL= option). It causes the total time to be automatically set, separately for each scenario, to the maximum possible time supported by the piecewise linear survival curve(s) in that scenario. It is not compatible with the ACCRUALTIME=MAX option or the FOLLOWUPTIME=MAX option.

statements.name: TWOSAMPLEWILCOXON
statements.description: The TWOSAMPLEWILCOXON statement performs power and sample size analyses for the Wilcoxon-Mann-Whitney test (also called the Wilcoxon rank-sum test, Mann-Whitney-Wilcoxon test, or Mann-Whitney U test) for two independent groups. Note that the O'Brien-Castelloe approach to computing power for the Wilcoxon test is approximate, based on asymptotic behavior as the total sample size gets large. The quality of the power approximation degrades for small sample sizes; conversely, the quality of the sample size approximation degrades if the two distributions are far apart, so that only a small sample is needed to detect a significant difference. But this degradation is rarely a problem in practical situations, in which experiments are usually performed for relatively close distributions.

arguments.name: ALPHA=
arguments.description: Specifies the level of significance of the statistical test. The default is 0.05, corresponding to the usual 0.05 x 100% = 5% level of significance.

arguments.name: GROUPNS=
arguments.description: Specifies the two group sample sizes.

arguments.name: GROUPWEIGHTS=
arguments.description: Specifies the sample size allocation weights for the two groups. This option controls how the total sample size is divided between the two groups. Each set of values across all groups represents relative allocation weights.

arguments.name: NBINS=
arguments.description: Specifies the number of categories (or "bins") each variable's distribution is divided into (unless it is ordinal, in which case the categories remain intact) in internal calculations. Higher values increase computational time and memory requirements but generally lead to more accurate results. However, if the value is too high, then numerical instability can occur. The default value is 1000.

arguments.name: NFRACTIONAL
arguments.description: Enables fractional input and output for sample sizes.

arguments.name: NPERGROUP=
arguments.description: Specifies the common sample size per group or requests a solution for the common sample size per group with a missing value (NPERGROUP==.). Use of this option implicitly specifies a balanced design.

arguments.name: NTOTAL=
arguments.description: Specifies the sample size or requests a solution for the sample size with a missing value (NTOTAL=.).

arguments.name: OUTPUTORDER=
arguments.description: Controls how the input and default analysis parameters are ordered in the output. OUTPUTORDER=INTERNAL is the default.

arguments.name: INTERNAL
arguments.description: Arranges the parameters in the output according to the following order of their corresponding options: SIDES NBINS= ALPHA= VARIABLES= GROUPWEIGHTS= NTOTAL= NPERGROUP= GROUPNS= POWER=

arguments.name: REVERSE
arguments.description: Arranges the parameters in the output in the reverse of the order in which their corresponding options are specified in the TWOSAMPLEWILCOXON statement.

arguments.name: SYNTAX
arguments.description: Arranges the parameters in the output in the same order in which their corresponding options are specified in the TWOSAMPLEWILCOXON statement.

arguments.name: POWER=
arguments.description: Specifies the desired power of the test or requests a solution for the power with a missing value (POWER=.). The power is expressed as a probability, a number between 0 and 1, rather than as a percentage. This option can be used only with the TEST=T and TEST=EQUIV analyses.

arguments.name: SIDES=
arguments.description: Specifies the number of sides (or tails) and the direction of the statistical test or confidence interval. The default value is 2.
One-sided with alternative hypothesis in same direction as effect
Two-sided

arguments.name: U
arguments.description: Upper one-sided with alternative greater than null value

arguments.name: L
arguments.description: Lower one-sided with alternative less than null value

arguments.name: TEST=
arguments.description: Specifies the Wilcoxon-Mann-Whitney test for two independent groups. This is the default test option.

arguments.name: WMW
arguments.description: Specifies the Wilcoxon-Mann-Whitney test for two independent groups.

arguments.name: VARDIST=
arguments.description: Defines a distribution for a variable, where label identifies the variable distribution in the output and with the VARIABLES= option. distribution specifies the distributional form of the variable.
arguments.help: VARDIST=ORDINAL | BETA | BINOMIAL | EXPONENTIAL | GAMMA | LAPLACE | LOGISTIC | LOGNORMAL | NORMAL | POISSON | UNIFORM

arguments.name: ORDINAL
arguments.description: Syntax: ORDINAL((values) : (probabilities)) Is an ordered categorical distribution. The values are any numbers separated by spaces. The probabilities are numbers between 0 and 1 (inclusive) separated by spaces. Their sum must be exactly 1. The number of probabilities must match the number of values.

arguments.name: BETA
arguments.description: Syntax: BETA (a, b <, l, r >) Is a beta distribution with shape parameters a and b and optional location parameters l and r. The values of a and b must be greater than 0, and l must be less than r. The default values for l and r are 0 and 1, respectively.

arguments.name: BINOMIAL
arguments.description: Syntax: BINOMIAL(p, n) Is a binomial distribution with probability of success p and number of independent Bernoulli trials n. The value of p must be greater than 0 and less than 1, and n must be an integer greater than 0.

arguments.name: EXPONENTIAL
arguments.description: Syntax: EXPONENTIAL(λ) Is an exponential distribution with scale λ, which must be greater than 0.

arguments.name: GAMMA
arguments.description: Syntax: GAMMA (α, λ) is a gamma distribution with shape α and scale λ. The values of a and λ must be greater than 0.

arguments.name: LAPLACE
arguments.description: Syntax: LAPLACE(θ, λ) Is a Laplace distribution with location θ and scale λ. The value of λ must be greater than 0.

arguments.name: LOGISTIC
arguments.description: Syntax: LOGISTIC(θ, λ) Is a logistic distribution with location θ and scale λ. The value of λ must be greater than 0.

arguments.name: LOGNORMAL
arguments.description: Syntax: LOGNORMAL(θ, λ) Is a lognormal distribution with location θ and scale λ. The value of λ must be greater than 0.

arguments.name: NORMAL
arguments.description: Syntax: NORMAL(θ, λ) Is a normal distribution with mean θ and standard deviation λ. The value of λ must be greater than 0.

arguments.name: POISSON
arguments.description: Syntax: POISSON(m) Is a Poisson distribution with mean m. The value of m must be greater than 0.

arguments.name: UNIFORM
arguments.description: Syntax: UNIFORM(l, r) Is a uniform distribution on the interval [l,r], where l < r.

arguments.name: VARIABLES=
arguments.description: Specifies the distributions of two or more variables, using labels specified with the VARDIST= option.
